glosses: with, containing; forms adjectives from nouns. This usage is treated as a "case suffix" and is separated from proper nouns by an apostrophe.

of, from; of a nation or place. This usage is treated as a "word-forming suffix" and is not separated from proper nouns by an apostrophe. The demonym formed this way functions equally as an adjective and as a noun. It is commonly encountered in surnames derived from the names of towns and cities.

examples.text: Tokat (“a city in northern Anatolia”) + -li → Tokatlı (“[a person] from Tokat”)

glosses: Added to sports organizations to form names for their fans.

examples.text: Ardahanspor (“a soccer team”) + -li → Ardahansporlu (“a person who supports this team”)

etymology:
Etymology tree
Proto-Turkic *-lig
Ottoman Turkish ـلو (-lı, -li, -lu, -lü)
Ottoman Turkish ـلی (-lı, -li, -lu, -lü)
Turkish -li
Inherited from Ottoman Turkish ـلی (-lı, -li, -lu, -lü), from ـلو (-lı, -li, -lu, -lü), from Proto-Turkic *-lig.
